entry.title: NASA Releases Report on Starliner Crewed Flight Test Investigation - NASA
entry.summary: At a news conference on Thursday, NASA released a report of findings from the Program Investigation Team examining the Boeing CST-100

entry.title: NASA to Provide Starliner Crew Flight Test Review Findings Today - NASA
entry.summary: During a news conference at 2 p.m. EST on Thursday NASA will discuss the findings of investigations into the 2024 crewed test flight of Boeing Starliner to

entry.title: 2026 News Releases - NASA
entry.summary: Sign up to receive NASA news releases and other information.

entry.title: Cardiac, Respiratory, and Exercise Research Wrap Week Aboard Station - NASA
entry.summary: The Expedition 74 crew wrapped up the week with cardiac and respiratory studies and conducting space exercise research to keep astronauts healthy off the Earth. The International Space Station residents also packed a SpaceX Dragon cargo spacecraft before its return to Earth and maintained science and life support hardware.

entry.title: Thursday Packed With Human Research as Station’s Orbit is Boosted - NASA
entry.summary: Relaxation, exercise, and biomedical studies were the key research objectives for the Expedition 74 crew on Thursday as NASA and its partners investigate ways to keep astronauts healthy on long-term missions. The International Space Station is also orbiting higher after the docked Progress 93 cargo craft fired its thrusters on Wednesday.

entry.title: NASA’s Perseverance Now Autonomously Pinpoints Its Location on Mars
entry.summary: Using the new Mars Global Localization algorithm, NASA’s Perseverance rover can now pinpoint its exact location without help from engineers on Earth.

entry.title: How Do Black Holes Form? NASA Finds Rare "Failed" Supernova
entry.summary: Using archival data from the NEOWISE mission, astronomers have captured the rare moment a massive star skipped the supernova phase and collapsed directly into a black hole.

entry.title: NASA Uses Generative AI to Navigate Mars with Perseverance Rover
entry.summary: In a first for planetary exploration, NASA utilized generative AI to map routes for the Perseverance rover, cutting planning time and increasing science returns.

entry.title: NISAR Satellite: NASA & ISRO Radar Peers Through Clouds
entry.summary: NASA’s NISAR mission reveals new details of the Mississippi River Delta’s forests and wetlands, proving radar’s power to monitor ecosystems regardless of weather.

entry.title: NASA Analysis Shows La Niña Limited Sea Level Rise in 2025
entry.summary: A mild La Niña caused greater rainfall over the Amazon basin, which offset rising sea levels due to record warming of Earth’s oceans.

entry.title: Networks Keeping NASA’s Artemis II Mission Connected
entry.summary: Artemis missions rely on both the Near Space Network, managed by NASA Goddard, and the Deep Space Network, managed by the Jet Propulsion Laboratory.

entry.title: NASA’s Juno Measures Thickness of Europa’s Ice Shell
entry.summary: Results from the solar-powered spacecraft provide a new measurement of the thickness of the ice shell encasing the Jovian moon’s ocean.

entry.title: How NASA Is Homing in From Space on Ocean Debris
entry.summary: Space-based technology could help track plastic and other flotsam by its ‘fingerprints.’

entry.title: NASA, SpaceX Launch US-European Satellite to Monitor Earth’s Oceans
entry.summary: Sentinel-6B will extend a decades-long legacy of global sea level measurements that help forecast weather, protect coastal communities, and more.

entry.title: Rocket Lab Prepares To Launch Latest Hypersonic Test Mission for Defense Innovation Unit | Rocket Lab
entry.summary: Long Beach, Calif. February 12, 2026: Rocket Lab Corporation (Nasdaq: RKLB) (“Rocket Lab” or “the Company”), a global leader in launch services and space systems, today announced its next launch is a dedicated mission on its HASTE rocket for the Department of War’s Defense Innovation Unit (DIU).
